name: TIFF Lightbox
address: 350 King St W, Toronto, ON M5V 3X5
description: This centre of the Toronto International Film Festival features world cinema & events year-round.

name: Hot Docs Ted Rogers Cinema
address: 506 Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M5S 1Y3
description: Restored 1913 movie theatre that screens documentaries & independent film festival fare.

name: Revue Cinema
description: Historic community-run theatre with 2nd-run Hollywood films & regular special-interest screenings.

name: Paradise Theatre
address: 1006c Bloor St W, Toronto, ON M6H 1M2
description: Paradise Theatre was built and opened in 1937. Initially, it served as a typical neighborhood cinema. Over the years, it underwent several renovations and functional transformations, evolving into a multifunctional cultural entertainment center. In its early years, the theater mainly screened films, but it later hosted various live performances, concerts, and theatrical productions.

name: Imagine Cinemas Carlton Cinema
description: Multiplex with film-themed art showing Hollywood, independent, Canadian & foreign flicks.

name: CineCycle
description: This funky coffee bar, bicycle repair shop & cinema is located in an old coach house down an alley.

name: Fox Theatre
address: 2236 Queen St E, Toronto, ON M4E 1G2
description: Long-running, single-screen movie theatre with retro flair showing second-run & independent films.

name: The Royal
description: Refurbished 1939 cinema screening independent films, global documentaries & 2nd-run features.

name: Kingsway Theatre
address: 3030 Bloor St W, Etobicoke, ON M8X 2Y8
description: Updated 1939 theatre with a classic feel, showing foreign films, docs & occasional blockbusters.

name: Innis Town Hall
address: Innis College, 2 Sussex Ave, Toronto, ON M5S 1J5
description: The heart and hub of Innis College, Town Hall (IN112) is a purpose-built, fully equipped, 4K-digital theatre with a warm and inviting ambience. A popular rental venue for film festivals and artistic/cultural events.
